meanings.definition: A device or structure that dissipates energy or heat.
meanings.sent1: The dissipator in the engine helps cool it down.
meanings.sent2: The dissipator on the computer prevents it from overheating.
meanings.sent3: The little dissipator in the toaster seemed to be working overtime.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a dissipator, spreading warmth to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The dissipator hummed softly as it absorbed the excess heat.

meanings.definition: One who dissipates or wastes resources.
meanings.sent1: The reckless dissipator spent all his money on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the family dissipator, always mismanaging their budget.
meanings.sent3: The dissipator of snacks in the office was caught red-handed in the break room.
meanings.sent4: His carefree attitude made him a dissipator of opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The dissipator of goodwill, he never appreciated the help he received.

meanings.sent1: The wind helped dissipator the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent2: She used a fan to dissipator the smell in the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to dissipator the cards in the air.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to dissipator any doubts she had.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd seemed to dissipator into the night.
